query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
1 «Poscia che Costantin l’aquila volse 2 contr’ al corso del ciel, ch’ella seguio 3 dietro a l’antico che Lavina tolse,
query.error: **English:** 1 After Constantine turned the eagle 2 against the course of the heavens, which it followed 3 behind the ancient one who took Lavinia,
query.result: 1 Siððan Constantinus ðone earn awende 2 ongean ðæs heofones ræd, ðone he ær folgode 3 æfter ðam ealdan ðe Latinum genam,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
4 cento e cent’ anni e più l’uccel di Dio 5 ne lo stremo d’Europa si ritenne, 6 vicino a’ monti de’ quai prima uscìo;
query.error: **English:** 4 for a hundred and a hundred years and more the bird of God 5 remained in the farthest west of Europe, 6 near the mountains from which it first came forth;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
7 e sotto l’ombra de le sacre penne 8 governò ’l mondo lì di mano in mano, 9 e, sì cangiando, in su la mia pervenne.
query.error: **English:** 7 and under the shadow of its sacred wings 8 it governed the world there from hand to hand, 9 and, thus changing, it came into my possession.
query.result: 7 and under ðære halgan fiðre sceade 8 weold ða woruld ðær of handa to handa, 9 and, swa wrixlende, on mine becwom.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
10 Cesare fui e son Iustinïano, 11 che, per voler del primo amor ch’i’ sento, 12 d’entro le leggi trassi il troppo e ’l vano.
query.error: **English:** 10 Caesar I was, and I am Justinian, 11 who, through the will of the first love that I feel, 12 drew out the superfluous and the vain from within the laws.
query.result: 10 Casere wæs ic and eom Iustinianus, 11 ðe, ðurh ðæs ærestan lufan willan ðe ic lufige, 12 of innan ðam gesetnessum ðæt oferflēdelice and ðæt īdle ic ābræd.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
13 E prima ch’io a l’ovra fossi attento, 14 una natura in Cristo esser, non piùe, 15 credea, e di tal fede era contento;
query.error: **English:** 13 And before I was attentive to the work, 14 I believed that there was only one nature in Christ, 15 and I was content with that faith;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
16 ma ’l benedetto Agapito, che fue 17 sommo pastore, a la fede sincera 18 mi dirizzò con le parole sue.
query.error: **English:** 16 but the blessed Agapetus, who was 17 supreme pastor, directed me to the true faith 18 with his words.
query.result: 16 ac se hælga Agapitus, se wæs 17 heahhyrde, me to ðære rihtan geleafan 18 mid his wordum gerihtte.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
19 Io li credetti; e ciò che ’n sua fede era, 20 vegg’ io or chiaro sì, come tu vedi 21 ogni contradizione e falsa e vera.
query.error: **English:** 19 I believed him; and that which was in his faith, 20 I see now as clearly as you see 21 every contradiction, both false and true.
query.result: 19 Ic him gelyfde; and ðæt ðe on his geleafan wæs, 20 ic geseo nu swutollice, swa ðu gesyhst 21 ælce andsac and lease and soðe.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
22 Tosto che con la Chiesa mossi i piedi, 23 a Dio per grazia piacque di spirarmi 24 l’alto lavoro, e tutto ’n lui mi diedi;
query.error: **English:** 22 As soon as I set out with the Church, 23 God in his grace was pleased to inspire me 24 with the great task, and I devoted myself entirely to it;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
25 e al mio Belisar commendai l’armi, 26 cui la destra del ciel fu sì congiunta, 27 che segno fu ch’i’ dovessi posarmi.
query.error: **English:** 25 and I entrusted my army to my Belisarius, 26 to whom the hand of heaven was so closely allied, 27 that it was a sign that I should rest.
query.result: 25 and ic Belisarium minre fyrde bebead, 26 ðam wæs ðæs heofonrices swiðre hand swa gehende, 27 ðæt hit wæs tacen ðæt ic me gerestan sceolde.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
28 Or qui a la question prima s’appunta 29 la mia risposta; ma sua condizione 30 mi stringe a seguitare alcuna giunta,
query.error: **English:** 28 Now here my answer is directed to the first question; but its condition 29 constrains me to follow it with an addition, 30 so that you may see with how much reason
query.result: 28 Nu her min andsware is fæstnod to ðære frumspece; ac hire gecynd 29 genyd me to fylgenne mid sume geicunge, 30 ðæt ðu geseo mid hu micelre gesceade

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
31 perché tu veggi con quanta ragione 32 si move contr’ al sacrosanto segno 33 e chi ’l s’appropria e chi a lui s’oppone.
query.error: **English:** 31 So that you may see with how much reason 32 it moves against the sacrosanct sign 33 and who appropriates it and who opposes it.
query.result: 31 Þæt ðu geseo mid hú micelre rihte 32 hit styreð ongean ðæt hālga tācn 33 and hwā hit him tōēgnað and hwā him wiðstent.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
34 Vedi quanta virtù l’ha fatto degno 35 di reverenza; e cominciò da l’ora 36 che Pallante morì per darli regno.
query.error: **English:** 34 See how much virtue has made him worthy 35 of reverence; and it began from the hour 36 that Pallas died to give him kingship.
query.result: 34 Geseoh ðu hu micel mægen hine geworðode 35 weorðmynda; and ongan ða ða giet 36 ðe ðe Palante wearð ofslægen ðæt he him rice forgeaf.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
37 Tu sai ch’el fece in Alba sua dimora 38 per trecento anni e oltre, infino al fine 39 che i tre a’ tre pugnar per lui ancora.
query.error: **English:** 37 You know that he made his dwelling in Alba 38 for three hundred years and more, until the end, 39 when the three fought for him again, three against three.
query.result: 37 ðu wast ðæt he geworhte on Alba his wununge 38 ðreo hund wintra and ma oð ðone ende, 39 ða ða ða ðreo feohtende wæron eft for him, ðreo wið ðrim.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
40 E sai ch’el fé dal mal de le Sabine 41 al dolor di Lucrezia in sette regi, 42 vincendo intorno le genti vicine.
query.error: **English:** 40 And you know that he made the faith from the evil of the Sabines 41 to the sorrow of Lucretia in seven kings, 42 conquering the neighboring peoples all around.
query.result: 40 And þu wast ðæt ðe geleaffulnesse fram ðæra Sabina yfele 41 oð ðone Lucretian sare on seofon cyningum, 42 oferwinnende ymb ða neawestan þeoda.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
43 Sai quel ch’el fé portato da li egregi 44 Romani incontro a Brenno, incontro a Pirro, 45 incontro a li altri principi e collegi;
query.error: **English:** 43 Do you know what he made the noble Romans carry 44 against Brennus, against Pyrrhus, 45 against the other leaders and their troops;
query.result: 43 Watst ðu ðone ðe ða æðelan Rómware 44 ongean Brennus, ongean Pyrrhus, ongean ða oðre ealdras and heora gefylce 45 bær?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
46 onde Torquato e Quinzio, che dal cirro 47 negletto fu nomato, i Deci e ’ Fabi 48 ebber la fama che volontier mirro.
query.error: **English:** 46 so that Torquatus and Quinctius, who was surnamed Cincinnatus 47 from his neglected hair, the Decii and the Fabii 48 had the fame that I gladly mirror.
query.result: 46 Swa ðæt Torquatus and Quinctius, ðe fram ðam locce 47 unlætan wæs nemned, ða Decii and ða Fabii 48 hæfdon ðone lof ðe ic lustlice mærse.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
49 Esso atterrò l’orgoglio de li Aràbi 50 che di retro ad Anibale passaro 51 l’alpestre rocce, Po, di che tu labi.
query.error: **English:** 49 He brought low the pride of the Arabs 50 who crossed the Alpine rocks behind Hannibal, 51 from which you, Po, flow.
query.result: 49 He afeoll ðara Arabais ofermod 50 ðe ðurh Hannibal ofer ða alpan comon, 51 ðone munt ðone hean, ðanon ðu, Po, lætest.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
52 Sott’ esso giovanetti trïunfaro 53 Scipïone e Pompeo; e a quel colle 54 sotto ’l qual tu nascesti parve amaro.
query.error: **English:** 52 Beneath him the young men Scipio and Pompey will triumph, 53 and to that hill beneath which you were born he seemed bitter.
query.result: 52 Under him ða geongan Scipio and Pompeius 53 sigorað, and ðam beorge ðe ðu under geboren wære 54 he ðuhte bealofull.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
55 Poi, presso al tempo che tutto ’l ciel volle 56 redur lo mondo a suo modo sereno, 57 Cesare per voler di Roma il tolle.
query.error: **English:** 55 Then, near the time when all the heavens willed 56 to return the world to its serene state, 57 Caesar took it by the will of Rome.
query.result: 55 Þa, neah ðære tide ðe eall heofon wolde 56 gerihtan ðone weorold to his willan serene, 57 Casere ðurh willan Rome ða genam.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
58 E quel che fé da Varo infino a Reno, 59 Isara vide ed Era e vide Senna 60 e ogne valle onde Rodano è pieno.
query.error: **English:** 58 And what he did from the Var to the Rhine, 59 the Isère saw and the Era and the Seine saw 60 and every valley from which the Rhône is full.
query.result: 58 And ðæt ðe he worhte fram ðam Wærum oð ðone Rin, 59 Isere geseah and Era and geseah Sigene 60 and æghwylc denu ðanon Rodan is full.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
61 Quel che fé poi ch’elli uscì di Ravenna 62 e saltò Rubicon, fu di tal volo, 63 che nol seguiteria lingua né penna.
query.error: **English:** 61 What he did after he left Ravenna 62 and crossed the Rubicon was of such speed 63 that neither tongue nor pen could follow it.
query.result: 61 Þæt ðe he ða dyde syððan he of Rawenne 62 gewende and ofer Rúbicon astah, wæs swylces flytes, 63 ðæt him nænig tunge ne mæg æfterfyligan ne nænig penne.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
64 Inver’ la Spagna rivolse lo stuolo, 65 poi ver’ Durazzo, e Farsalia percosse 66 sì ch’al Nil caldo si sentì del duolo.
query.error: **English:** 64 Toward Spain he turned his army, 65 then toward Durazzo, and struck Pharsalia 66 so that the Nile felt the pain in its warm waters.
query.result: 64 Wið Spagne he wende his werod, 65 ða wið Dyrrhachium, and Farsale gesloh, 66 swa ðæt ðæt Niðes wæter wearð onæled ðæs wædles.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
67 Antandro e Simeonta, onde si mosse, 68 rivide e là dov’ Ettore si cuba; 69 e mal per Tolomeo poscia si scosse.
query.error: **English:** 67 Antenor and Sinon, from where they moved, 68 he saw again, and where Hector lies buried; 69 and then he moved badly for Ptolemy.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
70 Da indi scese folgorando a Iuba; 71 onde si volse nel vostro occidente, 72 ove sentia la pompeana tuba.
query.error: **English:** 70 From there he descended, thundering, to Juba; 71 then he turned to your west, 72 where he heard the Pompeian trumpet.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
73 Di quel che fé col baiulo seguente, 74 Bruto con Cassio ne l’inferno latra, 75 e Modena e Perugia fu dolente.
query.error: **English:** 73 Of what he did with the following standard-bearer, 74 Brutus with Cassius barks in Hell, 75 and Modena and Perugia were sorrowful.
query.result: 73 Of ðæm ðe he dyde mid ðæm bæran folgiendum, 74 Brutus mid Cassian on helle hlyðað, 75 and Modena and Perusia wæron sarige.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
76 Piangene ancor la trista Cleopatra, 77 che, fuggendoli innanzi, dal colubro 78 la morte prese subitana e atra.
query.error: **English:** 76 Still weeps the sad Cleopatra, 77 who, fleeing before him, from the asp 78 took sudden and black death.
query.result: 76 Þa gyt wepeð seo earme Cleopatre, 77 ðe ðe ðam wyrme fleonde onweg, 78 ðone deað ðurh ðone næddran genam.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
79 Con costui corse infino al lito rubro; 80 con costui puose il mondo in tanta pace, 81 che fu serrato a Giano il suo delubro.
query.error: **English:** 79 With him he rode as far as the Red Sea; 80 with him he brought the world to such peace 81 that the temple of Janus was closed.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
82 Ma ciò che ’l segno che parlar mi face 83 fatto avea prima e poi era fatturo 84 per lo regno mortal ch’a lui soggiace,
query.error: **English:** 82 But that which made the sign that causes me to speak 83 had been done before and was being done afterwards 84 for the mortal realm that is subject to him,
query.result: 82 Ac ðæt ðe ðæt tacn ðe sprecan mæg 83 geworht hæfde ær and siððan weorðan sceolde 84 ðurh ðone deadlican rīce ðe him underþeodde wæs,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
85 diventa in apparenza poco e scuro, 86 se in mano al terzo Cesare si mira 87 con occhio chiaro e con affetto puro;
query.error: **English:** 85 becomes small and obscure in appearance, 86 if it is looked at with a clear eye and pure affection 87 in the hands of the third Caesar;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
88 ché la viva giustizia che mi spira, 89 li concedette, in mano a quel ch’i’ dico, 90 gloria di far vendetta a la sua ira.
query.error: **English:** 88 for the living justice that inspires me 89 granted him, in the hands of the one I speak of, 90 the glory of avenging his wrath.
query.result: 88 forðæm ðe seo lybbende rihtwisnes ðe mec spyreð, 89 sealde him, on ðæs handum ðe ic secge, 90 wuldor ðæt he his yrre gewræce.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
91 Or qui t’ammira in ciò ch’io ti replìco: 92 poscia con Tito a far vendetta corse 93 de la vendetta del peccato antico.
query.error: **English:** 91 Now you marvel at what I reply to you: 92 afterwards with Titus he went to take vengeance 93 for the vengeance of the ancient sin.
query.result: 91 Nu ðu wundrast on ðam ðe ic ðe andwyrde: 92 siððan mid Tito wæs teon wrecan 93 ðæs teonan ðe ðurh ða synne ær

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
94 E quando il dente longobardo morse 95 la Santa Chiesa, sotto le sue ali 96 Carlo Magno, vincendo, la soccorse.
query.error: **English:** 94 And when the Lombard tooth bit 95 the Holy Church, under its wings 96 Charlemagne, conquering, came to its aid.
query.result: 94 And ða ðæs Longbeardes toð bit 95 ða halgan gelaðunge, under ðinum fultumum, 96 Carolus ða cyning, sigelīðende, ða gesohte.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
97 Omai puoi giudicar di quei cotali 98 ch’io accusai di sopra e di lor falli, 99 che son cagion di tutti vostri mali.
query.error: **English:** 97 Oh, you can judge those people 98 whom I accused above and their sins, 99 which are the cause of all your troubles.
query.result: 97 Eala ðu miht gedeman ðara cnihta 98 ðe ic ær sæde and heora synna, 99 ða syndon ðinra yrmða fruman.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
100 L’uno al pubblico segno i gigli gialli 101 oppone, e l’altro appropria quello a parte, 102 sì ch’è forte a veder chi più si falli.
query.error: **English:** 100 One opposes the yellow lilies to the public standard, 101 and the other appropriates that for his own party, 102 so that it is hard to see who is more at fault.
query.result: 100 Se an ðone heretoch ða geolo gripan 101 on ða oðre healfe, and ða æfter ðam 102 ða æscberendan ða ðone eorl ofslogon.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
103 Faccian li Ghibellin, faccian lor arte 104 sott’ altro segno, ché mal segue quello 105 sempre chi la giustizia e lui diparte;
query.error: **English:** 103 Let the Ghibellines do their work 104 under another sign, for he who 105 separates justice from himself always follows evil;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
106 e non l’abbatta esto Carlo novello 107 coi Guelfi suoi, ma tema de li artigli 108 ch’a più alto leon trasser lo vello.
query.error: **English:** 106 and let not this new Charles crush them 107 with his Guelphs, but let him fear the claws 108 that tore the hide from a mightier lion.
query.result: 106 and ne ābēate ðis niwe Carla 107 mid his Welfum, ac ondræde ðā næglas 108 ðe æt ðǣm mǣran lēone ðā fēðerru tōglufon.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
109 Molte fïate già pianser li figli 110 per la colpa del padre, e non si creda 111 che Dio trasmuti l’armi per suoi gigli!
query.error: **English:** 109 Many times have the children wept 110 for the fault of the father, and it should not be believed 111 that God changes his weapons for his lilies!
query.result: 109 Fela sïðe ær ða bearn weopon 110 ðurh ðæs fæder gylt, and nis ðæt gerysne 111 ðæt God ælda geweald âwende for ðære lylian!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
112 Questa picciola stella si correda 113 d’i buoni spirti che son stati attivi 114 perché onore e fama li succeda:
query.error: **English:** 112 This little star is adorned 113 with the good spirits who were active 114 so that honor and fame might succeed them:
query.result: 112 Þeos lytle steorra bið gefrætewod 113 ðæra goda gasta ðe geworhte wæron 114 ðurh ðæt ðe him âr and wurðmynt gelimpan sceolde:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
115 e quando li disiri poggian quivi, 116 sì disvïando, pur convien che i raggi 117 del vero amore in sù poggin men vivi.
query.error: **English:** 115 and when desires rest here, 116 thus straying, it is necessary that the rays 117 of true love rise less vividly above.
query.result: 115 and ðonne ða wilnunga hider stigað, 116 ðus gedwolene, ðonne bið ðearf ðæt ða leoman 117 ðæs soðan lufu læssan up stigað.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
118 Ma nel commensurar d’i nostri gaggi 119 col merto è parte di nostra letizia, 120 perché non li vedem minor né maggi.
query.error: **English:** 118 But in the measuring of our merits 119 is part of our joy, 120 because we see them neither less nor greater.
query.result: 118 Ac on ðæm gemete ðara ure gylta 119 is dæl ure lisse, 120 forðæmðe we hi ne geseoð læsse ne mare.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
121 Quindi addolcisce la viva giustizia 122 in noi l’affetto sì, che non si puote 123 torcer già mai ad alcuna nequizia.
query.error: **English:** 121 Therefore, living justice sweetens 122 the affection in us so much that it cannot 123 ever be turned to any wickedness.
query.result: 121 Forðæm geliðað ða liflicu rihtwisnys 122 ðone willan on us swa ðæt he næfre ne mæg 123 gewendan to ænigum unrihte.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
124 Diverse voci fanno dolci note; 125 così diversi scanni in nostra vita 126 rendon dolce armonia tra queste rote.
query.error: **English:** 124 Diverse voices make sweet notes; 125 so do diverse stations in our life 126 render sweet harmony among these wheels.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
127 E dentro a la presente margarita 128 luce la luce di Romeo, di cui 129 fu l’ovra grande e bella mal gradita.
query.error: **English:** 127 And within this pearl 128 shines the light of Romeo, whose 129 great and beautiful work was ill-rewarded.
query.result: 127 And innan ðære gimme 128 scineð ðæs leohtscipe Romea, ðæs 129 weorc wæs mære and fæger yfele forgolden.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
130 Ma i Provenzai che fecer contra lui 131 non hanno riso; e però mal cammina 132 qual si fa danno del ben fare altrui.
query.error: **English:** 130 But the Provençals who acted against him 131 have not laughed; and therefore he fares badly 132 who harms himself by doing good to others.
query.result: 130 Ac ða Provenscean ðe ongean hine dydon 131 ne hlógon; and forðý yfle gæð 132 se ðe himsylfum wyrðð to hryre ðurh ðæt ðe he oðrum wel doð.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
133 Quattro figlie ebbe, e ciascuna reina, 134 Ramondo Beringhiere, e ciò li fece 135 Romeo, persona umìle e peregrina.
query.error: **English:** 133 He had four daughters, and each a queen, 134 Raymond Berenger, and this made for him 135 Romeo, a humble and pilgrim person.
query.result: 133 He hæfde feower dohtra, and ælc wæs cwēn, 134 Ramund Berenger, and ðæt him geworhte 135 Romeo, eaðmod and elþeodig man.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
136 E poi il mosser le parole biece 137 a dimandar ragione a questo giusto, 138 che li assegnò sette e cinque per diece,
query.error: **English:** 136 And then he moved his wicked words 137 to demand justice from this just man, 138 who assigned him seven and five for ten,
query.result: 136 And ða he hreowlice his wordum mælde 137 to ascian ðone rihtwisan be ðam rihte, 138 se ðe him seofon and fif to teonum sealde,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
139 indi partissi povero e vetusto; 140 e se ’l mondo sapesse il cor ch’elli ebbe 141 mendicando sua vita a frusto a frusto,
query.error: **English:** 139 then departed poor and old; 140 and if the world knew the heart he had 141 begging for his life bit by bit,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
142 assai lo loda, e più lo loderebbe».
query.error: **English:** 142 it would praise him greatly, and would praise him more.
query.result: 142 ðonne hine manig man mycclum gelyfde, and his lof wide sprang.
